snippet: American warplanes launched airstrikes against Sunni militants in northern Iraq on Friday, destroying rebel positions around Erbil, the Kurdish capital.
abstract: United States launches series of airstrikes against Sunni militants in Northern Iraq; strikes are intended to slow advance of militants from Islamic State in Iraq and Syria toward Kurdish capital of Erbil, home to United States Consulate and thousands of Americans.

byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN, TIM ARANGO and HELENE COOPER
byline.contributor: Alissa J. Rubin reported from Dohuk, Iraq, Tim Arango from Baghdad and Helene Cooper from Washington. Omar Al-Jawoshy contributed reporting from Baghdad, Somini Sengupta from the United Nations and Kimiko De Freytas-Tamura from London.

lead_paragraph: American warplanes launched airstrikes against Sunni militants in northern Iraq on Friday, destroying rebel positions around Erbil, the Kurdish capital.

headline.sub: Fighters Bomb Militant Sites Near Kurdish Capital
headline.main: U.S. Jets and Drones Attack Militants in Iraq, Hoping to Stop Advance
headline.print_headline: U.S. Jets and Drones Attack Militants in Iraq
